name: Canadian Tire
address: Canadian Tire, 1350 Main St, North Vancouver, BC V7J 1C6

featured_reviews.review_id:
The CT Triangle website is an excellent e-commerce HUB. I really like the aisle locator feature and the inventory availability seems to be accurate.
The store clerks are friendly but as with many Retailers are NOT generally knowledgeable nor do they have any Authority to fix a problem.
I shopped at the North Van store and it has impressive displays and great selection. A nice place to shop.
HOWEVER, the CT self check out is a DISASTER
Overall I'd rate CT North Van better than average and a nice place to shop.
5 Stars requires new self checkout system
featured_reviews.review_text:

Thanks for the 4 stars, David. We hope we can make your next visit a 5 star visit! See you soon!

 Corporate Customer Experience Team

featured_reviews.review_id: As always I had success finding what I needed at my local Canadian Tire.  I was able to locate the item via the website and then had a staff member unlock the caged area where the item was stocked.  He was helpful, ensuring that I had the correct item number.  The bonus was that the item was even on sale!
featured_reviews.review_text: As always I had success finding what I needed at my local Canadian Tire.  I was able to locate the item via the website and then had a staff member unlock the caged area where the item was stocked.  He was helpful, ensuring that I had the correct item number.  The bonus was that the item was even on sale!
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text:
Thanks for the 5 stars review, Deanna! We are happy to hear that you enjoyed the service and the selection of items. We are looking forward to seeing you again!

The Corporate Customer Experience Team

featured_reviews.review_id: Great store with great outdoor and seasonal products
featured_reviews.review_text: Great store with great outdoor and seasonal products
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text:
Thanks for sharing your positive feedback! We're glad that you enjoy our store and we can't wait to have you back!

Corporate Customer Experience Team

featured_reviews.review_id:
Placed an order for a new set of all weather tires on Nov 1st. It was stated on the order confirmation email that the tires will be ready for pick up between Nov 2 and Nov 5. Tires were not ready for pick up until Nov 13. This was extremely frustrating.

Second issue was that I followed the Curbside Pickup workflow via the platform and on the webpage it said that my order was being prepared and that I was 4th in line. Just out of sheer luck, I had to use the washroom and decided to follow up on my order before walking back to my car. This is when the guy at the Automotive Parts counter told me that customers who bought tires cannot opt in for Curbside Pickup.

If this is the case then there is a bug on the platform and should therefore be fixed. If this is not true then shame on your staff for not providing proper customer service.

Frustrating customer experience to say the least!
featured_reviews.review_text:

Hi Christopher, your comment and experience are very important to us. Please feel free to call our customer service number at 1-800-387-8803 so we can help you further.

Corporate Customer Experience Team

featured_reviews.review_id: Canadian Tire in Park and Telford is my favourite location, the store is big, clean and bright. It's very beautiful during the Christmas time. The photos taken are from the Black Friday, it was busy but not too busy.
featured_reviews.review_text: Canadian Tire in Park and Telford is my favourite location, the store is big, clean and bright. It's very beautiful during the Christmas time. The photos taken are from the Black Friday, it was busy but not too busy.

featured_reviews.review_id: I recently visited Canadian Tire at Main in North Vancouver and was pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness of the store. Although it's not a big location, it had everything I needed and was easy to navigate. The staff were friendly and helpful, making my shopping experience more enjoyable. While it may not be a busy location, I appreciate the convenience of being able to quickly pop in and out without any crowds.

While it may not be a busy location, I appreciate the convenience of being able to quickly pop in and out without any crowds.

Corporate Customer Experience Team

featured_reviews.review_id:
I recently made a trip to Canadian Tire, expecting the typical courteous Canadian shopping experience. To my dismay, the staff were notably rude and indifferent. I spent a good amount of time wandering the aisles, hoping someone would notice my evident need for assistance. The absence of responsiveness was astounding, especially for a retail establishment of Canadian Tire's reputation.

Taking the initiative, I approached multiple staff members to voice my concerns and hopefully get the assistance I needed. To my shock, instead of being met with understanding or an apology, one of the employees sharply retorted, "Dude! What's your problem? I'm busy here!" This response was not only unprofessional but also an outright dismissal of a customer's genuine concerns.

The experience left a sour taste in my mouth. It's unfortunate to see such a decline in customer service, especially in a place like Canadian Tire, which has always been a go-to for many Canadians. I had always held the store in high regard, but this incident has made me reconsider future visits.

While everyone can have a bad day, the blatant disregard and subsequent rudeness were beyond justifiable. Customers deserve respect and attentive service, especially in an establishment as renowned as Canadian Tire. It's my sincere hope that the management addresses this issue, as no customer should ever leave feeling belittled or dismissed.
